intro: Eriachne ampla, commonly known as the large flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its flat, grass-like leaves and spikelet-based inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its seeds are dispersed by water, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas. Eriachne ampla plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
